soc.server

Class SOCForceEndTurnThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • soc.server.SOCForceEndTurnThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    class SOCForceEndTurnThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    Force this robot's turn to end, by calling GameHandler.endGameTurnOrForce(SOCGame, int, String, Connection, boolean). Done in a separate thread in case of deadlocks; see run() for more details. Created from SOCGameHandler.endTurnIfInactive(SOCGame, long) when that's called from SOCGameTimeoutChecker.run().

    Also calls SOCPlayer.addForcedEndTurn() to track "stubborn" slow/buggy robots.

    Before 2.0.00, this class was SOCServer.SOCForceEndTurnThread; split out in 2.0.00 to its own top-level class.

    Since:
    1.1.11
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        If our targeted robot player is still the current player, force-end their turn. If not current player but game is waiting for them to discard or pick free resources, choose randomly so the game can continue. Calls GameHandler.endGameTurnOrForce(SOCGame, int, String, Connection, boolean).
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
